title: Hafiz Foods, Inc. Recalls Samosas Containing Chicken Produced Without Benefit of Inspection
summary: WASHINGTON, July 17, 2020 – Hafiz Foods, Inc., a Houston, Texas establishment, is recalling approximately 675 pounds of chicken samosas that contain poultry produced without the benefit of federal inspection, the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The ready-to-cook...
impacted_products: •12-oz. box packages labeled “RAZA FOODS Chicken Samosa”
•100-oz clear plastic bags containing approximately 100 chicken samosas that do not bear any labeling or codes
